topics.title: Common Garden Birds
topics.subtitle: Learn to identify the birds you see in your garden

birds.name: Robin
birds.description: Distinctive orange-red breast and face, with brown upperparts. Often seen perched on garden fences and feeders.

birds.name: Blackbird
birds.description: Males are all black with a bright yellow-orange bill. Females are dark brown with mottled underparts.

birds.name: Blue Tit
birds.description: Small bird with bright blue cap, white face, and yellow breast. Very acrobatic at feeders.

birds.name: Great Tit
birds.description: Largest UK tit with black head, white cheeks, and yellow breast with a black stripe down the centre.

birds.name: House Sparrow
birds.description: Brown and grey plumage. Males have a black bib and grey crown. Often seen in small flocks.

birds.name: Starling
birds.description: Glossy black plumage with iridescent purple and green sheen. Yellow bill in summer, dark in winter.

birds.name: Wood Pigeon
birds.description: Large grey pigeon with white patches on neck and wings. Distinctive cooing call.

birds.name: Magpie
birds.description: Black and white plumage with long tail. Iridescent blue-green sheen on wings and tail.

birds.name: Chaffinch
birds.description: Males have pink breast and cheeks, blue-grey cap, and green rump. Females are brown with white wing bars.

birds.name: Dunnock
birds.description: Small, streaky brown bird with grey head and orange-brown legs. Often seen on the ground under bushes.
